Artifacts you control have “{1}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only as a sorcery.” and are Halo in addition to their other types.

When Squee enters, he deals 1 damage to each player.
Once during each of your turns, if Squee is in your graveyard or exile you may make a bet on a creature you control for return Squee to the battlefield. [i](When that creature next deals combat damage this turn and survives, return Squee to the battlefield)[/i]

{0}: Make a bet on a creature for a Treasure. Activate only as a sorcery and only once each turn.
{1}: Make a bet on a creature for two Treasures. Activate only as a sorcery and only once each turn.
{2}: Make a bet on a creature for three treasures. Activate only as a sorcery and only once each turn.

cards.card_name: UR08 Noncreature Wanna Bet on It
cards.rules_text: You make a Bet on a creature you control for three treasures. Then target opponent makes a bet on a creature they control for three treasures, that creature must block this turn if able. [i](When that creature next deals combat damage this turn and survives, create three treasure tokens. [/i]

cards.card_name: MX02 Sylvia, of the Old Ways
cards.rules_text:
Flying, Haste
As long as Sylvia is enchanted or equipped, she and dragons you control have double strike.

At the beginning of your end step, if Santus attacked this turn, target creature phases out until Santus next deals combat damage to a player. [i](Treat it and anything attached to it as though they don't exist until its controller's next turn.)[/i]

Whenever a creature you control dies, you may exile it and put a number of captive counters on it equal to its power. It gains “When the last captive counter is removed from this card, if it's exiled, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. 
Whenever Brulte deals combat damage to a player, remove a captive counter from each other card you own in exile.
This token can't block.
